hi Pranay.  Thanks for the response.  That change is going to be pretty bi=
g for me, so for now I would need to probably back-port that support, or lo=
ok for another workaround.
- Erik

To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
From=
: sspranay@...
Date: Fri, 8 Jan 2010 13:05:14 -0800
Subject: Re: [arc=
hive-crawler] heritrix-1.14.2: crawling faster than 5 docs/sec ; crawling m=
ore than 1 URI at a time from a single host


















 



  


   =
 
      
      
      

Hi Erik,

With Heritrix-3.0 comes the capability to=
 increase the number of parallel queues from default 1 to as_many_as_you_wi=
sh. 
So I think you will have to switch to H3.0 to make use of the feature.=


Thanks,
Pranay


--- On Fri, 1/8/10, Crawler User <crawleruser@...=
m> wrote:

From: Crawler User <crawleruser@...>
Subject: [archive-c=
rawler] heritrix-1.14.2: crawling faster than 5 docs/sec ; crawling more th=
an 1 URI at a time from a single host
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
D=
ate: Friday, January 8, 2010, 3:41 PM







 



    
      
      
      =




hi.  I need to increase my crawl rate on some hosts that I have permiss=
ion to crawl quickly.  
The fastest I can get the crawl to go right now is =
5 docs/second, with maximum "impoliteness" (delayFactor=3D 0.0, maxDelayMs=
=3D0, minDelayMs=3D0).  This is not quick enough for my needs.
I'm assuming=
 the bottleneck is this limitation:    "It is important to note that at any=
 given time only one URI from any given host is processed."      -- from: h=
ttps://webarchive. jira.com/ wiki/display/ Heritrix/ Frontier+ Settings
I'm=
 hoping that others have thought of a way to workaround or ideally remove t=
he "1-URI-at-a- time" restriction from Heritrix.
BTW, I dug through the arc=
hives and found this thread:  http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ archive=
-crawler/ message/2933
However, the suggested solution of writing my own Qu=
eueAssignmentPoli cy, and handling prerequisite problems, seems a little in=
volved for me.So I'm wondering if in the last 3.5 years this has become eas=
ier to accomplish.I'm hopeful that this statement from Gordon Mohr on that =
thread was prescient and the "multiple simultaneous URIs" option has return=
ed:
   (An earlier frontier implementation had an option for processing mul=
tiple URLs from a single queue/host at once, but the option was not carried=

    forward to the current recommended frontier implementation.  It may re=
turn as an option in a future version.)
I eagerly await your replies, Thank=
s!
-Erik

ft. Get it now.
